nodes.title: Article S10
nodes.summary:
The partial document covers the final provisions (DISPOSITIONS FINALES) of a statute or decree, likely for the Zairian National Olympic Committee. The main points are the procedures for amending the statutes, the fate of assets in case of dissolution, and the enactment clause. Specifically:
1.  Any proposal to modify the statutes must be communicated to the State Commissioner for Youth and Sports, and the National Olympic Committee can also propose modifications.
2.  In the event of dissolution, any surplus after debt liquidation must be transferred to the national Department of Youth and Sports.
3.  The decree repeals all contrary provisions and enters into force on the date of its signature.
The text concludes with a site disclaimer stating it is under construction and that the presented texts are not legally binding but reflect documents held by associations.

nodes.title: Article S3
nodes.summary:
The partial document covers Articles 1 through 6 of the statutes establishing the "Comité olympique national zaïrois" (C.O.N.Z.). The main points detailed are:

1.  The creation of the committee as a public utility organism with an unlimited duration.
2.  The establishment of its headquarters in Kinshasa, with the possibility of relocation.
3.  The committee's primary objectives, which include disseminating the Olympic movement in Zaire, ensuring Zaire's participation and representation at Olympic Games and congresses, organizing the Games if entrusted to Zaire, and promoting amateur sports.
4.  The committee's role as a liaison between national federations, the International Olympic Committee, and other national Olympic committees, with adherence to the Olympic Charter.
5.  The committee's functions as the controlling and coordinating body for sport in Zaire, including grouping and supporting federations, coordinating their activities, advising on subsidies, maintaining international relations, arbitrating disputes, organizing national games, and proposing measures to develop national sport.
6.  A prohibition against any form of discrimination and any discussion of political or religious character.

nodes.title: Article S5
nodes.summary: The partial document outlines the organizational structure, means of action, and operational rules of the National Olympic Committee of Zaire (now the Democratic Republic of Congo). It details the committee's executive body composition, roles of officers, membership requirements, meeting procedures, and the composition and convocation of its general assembly.

nodes.title: Article S7
nodes.summary:
This partial document outlines the financial provisions governing the National Olympic Committee of Zaire. The main points covered are:

1.  The sources of the Committee's financial resources, including state subsidies, donations, and revenue from its own events.
2.  The oversight powers of state-appointed auditors to review all accounting documents and their duty to report any negligence or irregularities.
3.  A condition for federations receiving financial aid, stipulating they must submit their previous year's budgets and accounts before receiving further subsidies.
